intro: Cryptolepis lancifolia, commonly known as African snake root, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often branching stems. The plant has alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are usually hairy on the underside. Its small, white or yellowish flowers are clustered in umbels, and it produces small, woody fruits containing several seeds. Cryptolepis lancifolia is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in various herbal remedies.
